div.p: An example of eco-evolutionary dynamics in the pike model including length at age 1 as a static trait y, in addition to length x and temperature T (details in Appendix S3). A model with zero heritability of y (model 1) is compared to a model with a heritability of 0.6 (model 2), as shown in the upper left panels. The resulting reproductive value functions for the two models are shown for the mean temperature. The lower left panel shows effects of temperature on various demographic outputs in the two models, while the lower right panel shows the marginal stable trait distributions of y and x for two temperatures, in the two models.
